meanings.sent1: The hospital room must be aseptic to keep patients safe.
meanings.sent2: The aseptic environment in the laboratory ensures accurate test results.
meanings.sent3: The chef's aseptic kitchen practices made sure no germs ruined the meal.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an aseptic room, clear of any harmful thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The aseptic field gleamed under the bright lights, untouched by any impurities.

meanings.definition: Using methods to prevent contamination or infection.
meanings.sent1: The aseptic techniques used by the surgeon kept the incision clean.
meanings.sent2: Aseptic procedures are crucial in food production to maintain quality.
meanings.sent3: The aseptic dance moves of the performer kept the audience captivated.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like aseptic barriers, shielding her from unwanted criticism.
meanings.sent5: The aseptic barrier around the garden protected the plants from pests and diseases.

meanings.sent1: The aseptic packaging ensured the milk stayed fresh for longer.
meanings.sent2: Aseptic conditions are necessary in pharmaceutical manufacturing.
meanings.sent3: The aseptic spaceship was free from any alien bacteria.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt aseptic, untouched by the pain of the past.
meanings.sent5: The aseptic room glowed white, like a beacon of cleanliness in the hospital.
